ox.gloss: any of various wild bovines especially of the genera Bos or closely related Bibos

ox-eyed daisy.gloss: tall leafy-stemmed Eurasian perennial with white flowers

oxalacetate.gloss: a salt or ester of oxalacetic acid

oxalacetic acid.gloss: an acid formed by oxidation of maleic acid (as in metabolism of fats and carbohydrates)

oxalic acid.gloss: a toxic colorless crystalline organic acid found in oxalis and other plants

oxalidaceae.gloss: a family of widely distributed herbs of the order Geraniales

oxalis.gloss: any plant or flower of the genus Oxalis

oxalis acetosella.gloss: Eurasian plant with heart-shaped trifoliate leaves and white purple-veined flowers

oxalis caprina.gloss: short-stemmed South African plant with bluish flowers

oxalis cernua.gloss: South African bulbous wood sorrel with showy yellow flowers

oxalis crenata.gloss: South American wood sorrel cultivated for its edible tubers

oxalis pes-caprae.gloss: South African bulbous wood sorrel with showy yellow flowers

oxalis tuberosa.gloss: South American wood sorrel cultivated for its edible tubers

oxalis violacea.gloss: perennial herb of eastern North America with palmately compound leaves and usually rose-purple flowers

oxaloacetate.gloss: a salt or ester of oxalacetic acid

oxaloacetic acid.gloss: an acid formed by oxidation of maleic acid (as in metabolism of fats and carbohydrates)

oxandra lanceolata.gloss: source of most of the lancewood of commerce

oxaprozin.gloss: a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (trade name Daypro)

oxazepam.gloss: a tranquilizing drug (trade name Serax) used to treat anxiety and insomnia and alcohol withdrawal

oxen.gloss: domesticated bovine animals as a group regardless of sex or age

oxeye.gloss: any North American shrubby perennial herb of the genus Heliopsis having large yellow daisylike flowers

oxeye daisy.gloss: tall leafy-stemmed Eurasian perennial with white flowers

oxford english dictionary.gloss: an unabridged dictionary constructed on historical principles

oxheart.gloss: any of several cultivated sweet cherries having sweet juicy heart-shaped fruits

oxheart cherry.gloss: any of several cultivated sweet cherries having sweet juicy heart-shaped fruits

oxidant.gloss: a substance that oxidizes another substance

oxidation-reduction.gloss: a reversible chemical reaction in which one reaction is an oxidation and the reverse is a reduction

oxidation number.gloss: the degree of oxidation of an atom or ion or molecule

oxidation state.gloss: the degree of oxidation of an atom or ion or molecule

oxidiser.gloss: a substance that oxidizes another substance

oxidizer.gloss: a substance that oxidizes another substance

oxidizing agent.gloss: a substance that oxidizes another substance

oxidoreduction.gloss: a reversible chemical reaction in which one reaction is an oxidation and the reverse is a reduction

oxlip.gloss: Eurasian primrose with yellow flowers clustered in a one-sided umbel

oxtongue.gloss: widespread European weed with spiny tongue-shaped leaves and yellow flowers

oxybenzene.gloss: a toxic white soluble crystalline acidic derivative of benzene

oxycephaly.gloss: a congenital abnormality of the skull

oxydendrum arboreum.gloss: deciduous shrubby tree of eastern North America having deeply fissured bark and sprays of small fragrant white flowers and sour-tasting leaves

oxygen.gloss: a nonmetallic bivalent element that is normally a colorless odorless tasteless nonflammable diatomic gas

oxyhaemoglobin.gloss: the bright red hemoglobin that is a combination of hemoglobin and oxygen from the lungs

oxyhemoglobin.gloss: the bright red hemoglobin that is a combination of hemoglobin and oxygen from the lungs

oxylebius pictus.gloss: greenling with whitish body marked with black bands

oxyphenbutazone.gloss: an anti-inflammatory drug (trade name Tandearil) used to treat arthritis and bursitis

oxyphencyclimine.gloss: an anticholinergic drug (trade name Daricon) used in treating peptic ulcers

oxytetracycline.gloss: a yellow crystalline antibiotic (trademark Terramycin) obtained from a soil actinomycete

oxytetracycline hydrochloride.gloss: a yellow crystalline antibiotic (trademark Terramycin) obtained from a soil actinomycete

oxytocic.gloss: a drug that induces labor by stimulating contractions of the muscles of the uterus

oxytocic drug.gloss: a drug that induces labor by stimulating contractions of the muscles of the uterus

oxytocin.gloss: hormone secreted by the posterior pituitary gland (trade name Pitocin)

oxytropis.gloss: large widely-distributed genus of evergreen shrubs or subshrubs having odd-pinnate leaves and racemose or spicate flowers each having a pea-like corolla with a clawed petal

oxytropis lambertii.gloss: tufted locoweed of southwestern United States having purple or pink to white flowers

oxyura jamaicensis.gloss: reddish-brown stiff-tailed duck of North America and northern South America

oxyuranus scutellatus.gloss: large highly venomous snake of northeastern Australia

oxidate.gloss: enter into a combination with oxygen or become converted into an oxide

oxidise.gloss: add oxygen to or combine with oxygen

oxidize.gloss: enter into a combination with oxygen or become converted into an oxide

oxygenate.gloss: impregnate, combine, or supply with oxygen

oxygenise.gloss: change (a compound) by increasing the proportion of the electronegative part
impregnate, combine, or supply with oxygen

oxygenize.gloss: change (a compound) by increasing the proportion of the electronegative part
impregnate, combine, or supply with oxygen

oxford-gray.gloss: of a dark shade of grey

oxford-grey.gloss: of a dark shade of grey

oxidized.gloss: combined with or having undergone a chemical reaction with oxygen
